result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Francis Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Negligent Operation of Motor Vehicle, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to pay court costs and DNA surcharge.  

To be paid at a rate of $25 per month beginning 12/05/18 and on the 5th of each month thereafter until paid in full.  

Defendant may submit proof of completion of 10 hours community service on company letterhead to the court and the court will remit costs if deemed appropriate.
Defendant has 3 days jail credit for time served.

Defendant Joseph Francis Taylor in court with attorney James Ritland.  Taavi Mc Mahon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def wishes to enter plea, defense files plea questionnaire.  Court advises rights, court finds defendant KVI waives rights and accepts plea.  Complaint used as factual basis and court finds defendant guilty.  Defendant sentenced.

Defendant not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant not to consume or possess alcohol and not to enter bars or taverns.  Defendant not to be on any premises where alcohol is sold for consumption.  Defendant is allowed to go to the My Second Home in Pigeon Falls for the purpose of eating food.  Defendant is not to consume alcohol while at the My Second Home.  Defendant can go to the My Second Home for the purpose of working, doing handyman jobs and removing scrap metal.
